channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bus stop F - Countdown unit not working, 15th October
item.description:
Bus stop F - Countdown unit not working Outside -: “The Portland Hospital, 205-209 Great Portland St, London W1W 5AH” (Bus Stop F). Despite previous reports indicating the matter has been resolved, the problem remains unaddressed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Portland Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 15th October
item.description:
There is an abandoned car taking up parking spaces. It has been there for over a year and is not being used as there is no number plate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bliss Crescent, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discriminatory practice, 15th October
item.description:
The council is providing residents with no services. It is questionable across the borough. Street cleaning rots are published without being true. In Winchmore Hill we are being targeted for even fewer services. The parks are filthy and unkempt, with trees decimated due to zero maintenance and wildlife dead as the council has allowed the mass growth of weeds that have suffocated any green grass we used to enjoy. Hoppers road has not been cleaned in over a month and most streets are covered in uncollected litter and waste that I clear for about two hours a day. This is all video evidenced. My immediate road has not been cleaned in weeks, despite the claim it is cleaned once a week. I reported human faeces over a week ago and still on college road. I reported broken glass on Downes Court months ago and that too is still there. This is the health and safety risk that the council have created. Poles have fallen down all around Grovelands lake and the council have not paid a penny in maintenance. For this my council tax has increased year upon year, with diminishing services in return. It is also tragedy and affront to church goers that for years they have refused to clean the streets outside St Paul’s church n church hill. I have been doing them myself, in the hope that the vicar does not realise the extent of the council’s disregard,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hoppers Road, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On temporary pavement ramp near bike hangar, 15th October
item.description:
My way as a wheelchair user and completely blocked by multiple bikes being parked on the ramp. I was unable to get close enough to get the numbers of the bikes (this should absolutely not be a requirement for reporting).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Delancey Street, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned motorcycles on public walkway, 14th October
item.description:
Previously reported - ref; 8125745 These motorcycles have been left outside my property for over 6 months. Yourselves nor Peabody want to take responsibility for their removal. I don’t understand why they cannot be removed nor who is responsible. They are a fire hazard and a danger to the public

item.title: Washing machine, large mattress, side tanle, 14th October
item.description:
In the very short stretch of footpath between Upper Montagu Street and Durweston Street there is a washing machine, a large mattress and a side table. There woukd be minimal cost for the Council to put up large notice on the black bins saying it is illegal to leave anything on the footpath, the only exception being bagged household rubbish by residents on their designated collection days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, York Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet
